quest.name: Death Unto Dawn
journal: Kan–E–Senna seems determined not to let the disappointment of Sharlayan's rejection distract her from the task at hand.

Your discussion with Kan–E–Senna is interrupted by the arrival of a flustered sylph bearing urgent news from Xelphatol. It would seem the Telophoroi have marched straight through the Ixal's homeland, scattering all before them on their way to the Carteneau Flats. Wasting no time, the Elder Seedseer orders the Twin Adders to ready their airships, and bids you join them on their journey to the battlefield.

Outside the airship port, you are surprised to find Arenvald, whom Fordola has brought all the way from Ul'dah in the hope of speaking with Alphinaud. Your happiness soon gives way to shock, however, when you discover that the youth is now confined to a wheelchair due to the injuries he sustained in the tower at Paglth'an. Having apparently resigned himself to the fact that he can no longer join the other Scions on their adventures, he asks Alphinaud to fight on in his stead and be the hero that he cannot. While these well-meaning words only add to the─largely self-inflicted─weight of expectations with which Alphinaud has been struggling, he seems grateful for the encouragement with battle just around the corner.

Their numbers bolstered by tempered beastmen and lunar primals, the legions of the Telophoroi test the newly forged Grand Company of Eorzea to its breaking point. As you and your fellow Scions descend upon the field of combat, it becomes apparent that the enemy have set their sights on an aetherial confluence buried deep beneath the ground, though their true designs remain a mystery. Knowing only that they must be stopped, you divide your forces and engage a nigh-endless army of foes, drawing upon hitherto untapped reserves of strength, and succeed at length in driving the Telophoroi hordes from their prize.

Heart still pounding, you look up to the heavens to find Fandaniel staring down at you intently. Making light of his failure, he declares that while the day may be yours, your efforts have earned you no more than a brief stay of execution, and with that he takes his leave. Whether the Ascian is right only time will tell, but the fact remains that when tested, the Grand Company of Eorzea emerged unbroken, which is surely cause to celebrate in itself. You permit yourself a weary smile, and troop from the field. Soon after, a grateful Lord Aymeric offers to fly you and your comrades back to the Rising Stones─where it becomes clear he has much to discuss.

Reasoning that the Grand Company of Eorzea can be relied upon to keep the Telophoroi at bay, Lord Aymeric requests that the Scions search instead for a means to neutralize the threat of the towers. Given Sharlayan's preeminence in the field of aetherological research, it is agreed that the solution will most likely be found there; along, perhaps, with knowledge pertaining to the Final Days. Unfortunately, you will not be able to confirm your suspicions until Krile has obtained permission for you all to set foot in the infamously insular nation, and a long wait seems in prospect.

Sometime later, you accompany Y'shtola and the others on an expedition to investigate the mechanism by which the towers absorb aether, and learn to your dismay that they are draining the lifeblood of the land itself. As you grimly turn for home, you hear an ephemeral voice call out to you and you alone...

It warns that the end draws nigh...and that the fate of the star is in your hands.

※The next main scenario quest will be available from Alphinaud once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Endwalker must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Death Unto Dawn.”
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud outside the Carline Canopy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Throughout my childhood, I remember Grandfather arguing with my father over Sharlayan's policy of nonintervention. And this time, it was my turn to play the role.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But if even my grandfather could not win him over, what chance had I? If words exist that may sway him, I know not what they are...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: With their knowledge, Sharlayan could have done so much for the cause! They could have helped us to uncover the secrets of the towers and save the tempered captives within, and yet─ Gods!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The Forum includes representatives from all of Sharlayan's central institutions. With them hindering Krile's investigation, she will struggle to make any headway on her own.

dialogue.name: SILENTCONJURER
dialogue.text: Have you more to discuss with the Elder Seedseer?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Lotus Stand?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: While Sharlayan's stance is indeed disappointing, we cannot allow ourselves to be distracted from the challenge before us. There is much and more to be done.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I shall begin by sharing the Forum's response with my counterparts in the Alliance. Meanwhile, I would ask that the Scions─

dialogue.name: SYLPHICSERVANT04066
dialogue.text: (-???-)Grave tidings, walking ones! Grave, grave tidings!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, my gentle friend. What has occurred?

dialogue.name: SYLPHICSERVANT04066
dialogue.text: These ones who went to see feathered ones send terrible news! Destroying ones have appeared in Xelphatol!

dialogue.name: SYLPHICSERVANT04066
dialogue.text: Destroying ones and captured ones and even frightful godly ones! Feathered ones didn't stand a chance and were sent flapping and squawking!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: When did this happen!? Is it too late to help them?

dialogue.name: SYLPHICSERVANT04066
dialogue.text: Too late, yes, much too late! But luckily, destroying ones were only passing through, and continued on west. Feathered ones who did not fight were left unharmed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: West... That would be Coerthas.

dialogue.name: BODYGUARD04066
dialogue.text: My lady, the Ishgardians report that the Telophoroi have emerged from the eastern highlands of Coerthas and are marching at speed.

dialogue.name: BODYGUARD04066
dialogue.text: Though their purpose has yet to be determined, the Carteneau Flats would seem their most likely destination. Lord Aymeric has already dispatched his forces, and requests our immediate support.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Tell him he shall have it. The time is come for the Grand Company of Eorzea to prove its worth.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well...mayhap it is a mercy that we do not have time to stew upon our misfortunes. Come, my friends, let us make haste to Carteneau!

dialogue.name: SYLPHICSERVANT04066
dialogue.text: W-Wait! This one almost forgot! Destroying ones were said to be led by cackling robed one! This one must see that all walking ones know! Farewell!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Fandaniel?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Who else. It was only a matter of time before that grinning maniac showed himself again.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I shall have an airship readied to bear you to Carteneau. Pray see to your preparations and report to the landing with all haste.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At once, my lady. Let us away.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The airship will be ready to depart ere long. I bid you make for the landing as soon as you are able. And may the Twelve keep you.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I have apprised our comrades at the Rising Stones of the situation. They will head directly to Carteneau.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud has been unexpectedly delayed... But you should probably go and see for yourself. He's by the entrance.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Come on. This'll only take a moment, all right?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename. It would seem Fordola here has come all the way to Gridania to find us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I have explained the situation, but she insists her business is urgent.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Aye, and it'll be over sooner if you shut up and come with me.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: After Paglth'an, I had assumed the Telophoroi would continue to target settlements, but it is plain they considered Xelphatol a mere obstacle on the road to Carteneau. What, then, draws them to the Flats? ...We must keep a close eye on their movements.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I rather doubt that Fordola obtained the chirurgeons' permission before bringing Arenvald halfway across the realm.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...And solely to deliver a message at that. They should both have known better! But what's done is done...and I will not soon forget his words.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You can tell me later what that was all about, but judging by the set of Alphinaud's jaw, it appears to have done him some good.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Thancred and the others have already left the Rising Stones. And according to the communications officer, Amalj'aa and kobold forces are also bound for Carteneau as we speak.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: They mean to keep the promise they made in Ala Mhigo, and we must do the same, by saving as many of their tempered kin as possible.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Anyway, the airship is ready to depart. We should get going.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Upon joining the battle at Carteneau, several cutscenes will play in sequence.
It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to participate in the battle and view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your progress through the battle will be saved at certain points. In the event that you are defeated, you will be able to try again from the most recent of these.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that if you enter battles associated with other quests or log out from the game, this progress will be lost.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 80 or above to proceed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As the Scions spread out across the field, Alisaie and G'raha take the fight to the Telophoroi...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Do you see that?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The glyph? Yes. How worried should we be?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Listen well, and judge for yourself. Though I can see aetherial currents, I had not thoroughly examined those that flow through the heart of Carteneau. But now that I am here, things have become clear.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Flats conceal an aetheric confluence, like to the pillars of the Azim Steppe, but greater in scale. Far greater.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The glyphs that Fandaniel has conjured reach into its very midst...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...And I believe I know their purpose. Should the lunar primals destroy them, it would spark a chain reaction with the potential to obliterate the confluence entirely.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The resultant disruption to the flow of aether would sow chaos among the elements, prompting earthquakes, floods, and tempests large enough to lay waste to the realm.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That he would go so far cometh as little surprise. We must needs protect the confluence at all costs.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, G'raha Tia and Alisaie prepare to lock swords with Lunar Ravana...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: At the selfsame moment, you stand shoulder to shoulder with Alphinaud and Estinien, resolved to lay Lunar Ifrit low...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The tempered that we were able to treat will be taken to the city–states for observation. As soon as the Alliance is satisfied that they're fully recovered, they will be free to return home.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At the close of the battle, when the clouds parted and the moon shone down on us all...I cannot well express how I felt. Somehow, it seemed more a beginning than an ending.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Throughout the battle, I could not shake the feeling that all present were performing for the amusement of Fandaniel.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Nor did his blithe reaction to this latest defeat give me cause to think otherwise. I can only conclude that such failures are of little consequence to his broader scheme...whatever it may be.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It was decent of Lord Aymeric to bear us home aboard his airship. The gods only know how we would have squeezed this many people onto the Bonanza...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I will recommend that the Alliance keep a closer watch over Carteneau. The Telophoroi may have failed in their attempt to destroy the confluence this time, but there is naught to stop them trying again.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The Carteneau Flats seem fated to play a prominent role in the history of the realm, do they not? I wonder...might the abundance of aether that floweth through the region have led the Allagans to entomb Omega there?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Many though the enemy were, their numbers consisted largely of tempered beastmen, with a few lunar primals to keep things interesting. The Garleans themselves ventured little, and lost less.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It has ever been the Empire's way to have others fight their battles, but even they would blush at the Telophoroi's use of tempered slaves.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You should've seen my face when Lord Aymeric turned up on our doorstep. Did none of you think to send word he was bringing you home?

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I trust you all enjoyed a comfortable flight aboard the pride of the Ishgardian fleet? Lest you worry, the Bonanza has been towed to a nearby location to be retrieved at your convenience.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You have thought of everything, Lord Aymeric. And may I say how much I appreciated the hospitality you afforded us on the way home.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it. Our destination lay in the same direction─and it afforded me the perfect opportunity to learn how my errant friend has been since last he took his leave.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: It would seem you have finally found a place to settle down.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hmph. I merely grew weary of wandering the Far East.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Returning to more serious matters─while the Telophoroi have been driven from Carteneau, 'tis like that the bulk of their forces yet remain.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: On the evidence of the Grand Company of Eorzea's first joint military operation, however, I am confident that we have the potential to meet such threats head-on─even without the aid of you and yours.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: As such, while our forces keep the Telophoroi at bay, I would ask that you apply your talents to the task of neutralizing the towers.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A sensible division of labor. While the towers remain, so too will the threat of the lunar primals.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And given our expertise in the field of aetherology, we are better qualified to find the solution.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That we are. Especially should it happen to lie beyond the Alliance's dominion.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: There is a time and a place for formal investigations, of course, but certain secrets are wont to hide where only enterprising individuals may venture.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I could not agree more. There are none better suited to this task, nor any upon whom I would rather rely.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: On behalf of the Alliance, I thank you. We look forward to receiving any information you are able to uncover.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: And with that, I must take my leave. Should you have need of assistance, pray do not hesitate to ask. Fare you well, my friends.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I confess, I had hoped to be able to study the towers more closely, vital as they plainly are to the Telophoroi's plans. If we can discern their ultimate function, we will be one step closer to understanding our enemy's grand scheme.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Should we succeed in neutralizing them, of course, it is all but certain that the Telophoroi will mount an all-out invasion.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And then it will begin. The one who awaits at the heart of the chaos will come for us. For you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Yet in the end, our true nemesis may be the calamity to end all calamities. The Final Days themselves.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Yes, all right, Alphinaud. We need a plan, not portents. As Thancred so eloquently pointed out, we are in a position to seek information from all manner of places, not least...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Sharlayan.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: According to Krile, the Forum have been more secretive than ever of late. While this may be related to the appearance of the Telophoroi, that remains a matter of speculation.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But one thing is clear: the Forum is determined to keep us from discovering the truth. Master Fourchenault's performance at the Lotus Stand was enough to convince me of that.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The matter beareth further investigation, I do heartily concur.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nor can I think of a more promising place to look for the answers we seek on the matter of the towers. Sharlayan hath ever been the wellspring of aetherological knowledge.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I care not where we go. Here or there, my lance will be ready.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And what of you, Forename? Might you be persuaded to join us?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Plot a course for Sharlayan!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If it means I can have words with Fourchenault...

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: An island of bookworms and bureaucrats? Have we no other choice?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hear, hear! It is time we laid bare the Telophoroi's dark designs!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Only after I do!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If he and his friends in the Forum think we'll leave them alone if they ignore us, they're in for a shock!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To be frank, I myself would sooner plump for a tropical paradise. But Krile does need our help, and who knows where the trail might lead us?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It appears we are in agreement. We have but to wait for Krile to secure the necessary permissions. In the meantime, there is a matter I would investigate.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Does it involve tall structures?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: By strange coincidence, it does. At present, I have only a creeping suspicion, but with your help, I will soon find out whether my fears are warranted.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have learned the emote Shush!
